channel.title: Converting .dat file extentions into .txt OR viewing .dat files properly?
channel.description:
Well, for some reason I can't seem to open my character files on my source. Obviously that's a real pain in the a**. They currently have the .dat file extension, and I'd like to have them as a configuration file, or have the .txt extension.
Does anyone either... 1. Know how to convert them and make my server create .txt char files instead? 2. Know how or what program to use in order to view these files properly?
I can't use the simple Notepad program that comes with Microsoft Windows or else it will appear as so... [code]¬í sr PlayerSaveZ@”¨_À°6 I playerHeadIconI playerHeightI playerPosXI playerPosYI playerRightsI playerStatus[ bankItemst [I[ bankItemsNq ~ [ playerEquipmentq ~ [ playerEquipmentNq ~ [ playerItemq ~ [ playerItemNq ~ [ playerLevelq ~ L playerNamet Ljava/lang/String;L playerPassq ~ [ playerQuestq ~ [ playerXPq ~ xp ...[/code]
It's even longer than that, that's just the piece BEFORE the 10,000 spaces between everything... As you can see, it's practically impossible to work with it in this format. I've tried Google searching for .dat file openers and such but they all don't seem to work, as they either don't display it any better or it's even more of a mess.
Any help, advice or even directing me onto the pathway of success is greatly appreciated! Thank you, have a nice day.

item.title: Converting .dat file extentions into .txt OR viewing .dat files properly?
item.dc:creator: @kid2kewl2bereal kid2kewl2bereal
item.description:
@kid2kewl2bereal wrote:

baddy351:

Oh, a config file for a char file would not do well. Use a xml or something. loook for the bufferedwriter in player save.

Whoops, thanks for realizing my typo, even though it was an accident! Haha, I meant a .txt file or something, even that would work better.

Read full topic

item.title: Converting .dat file extentions into .txt OR viewing .dat files properly?
item.dc:creator: @kid2kewl2bereal kid2kewl2bereal
item.description:
@kid2kewl2bereal wrote:

baddy351:

Use wordpad, that may work. Or use datviewer, its a command and conquer modding tool. Look up command and conquer generals modding. There is a tool that does that.

By convert I mean change the .java code from the source I’m using to, instead of using the .DAT file extension, use the .CFG extension to make a Configuration file instead.

Read full topic
